title: Facebook wasn't Thursday's only big loser — these 16 other Nasdaq-100 stocks dropped at least 5%
text:
Below is a list of the worst 20 performers among the Nasdaq-100 on Feb. 3., led by a 26% plunge in Meta Platforms Inc. FB following a disappointing fourth-quarter earnings announcement.

Read:Facebook stands to shed more than $200 billion in market value after rough earnings report

Here's how the broad indexes performed on Feb. 3:

The Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA fared best, declining 518 points, or 1.5%, to close at 35,111.16. Despite all the fear in the market as investors look ahead to an expected cycle of interest-rate increases by the Federal Reserve, the Dow has pulled back only 3.4% during 2022 and only 5% from its all-time intraday high set on Jan. 5.

The S&P 500 SPX pulled back 2.4% for the session. The benchmark index is now down 6.1% for 2022 and down 7.1% from its high set on Jan. 4.

The Nasdaq Composite Index COMP dropped 3.7% and is now down 11.3% for 2022 and 14.4% from its intraday high set on Nov. 22. The index is in correction territory, having fallen more than 10%.

The Nasdaq-100 Index NDX, made up of the largest nonfinancial companies in the full Nasdaq and tracked by the Invesco QQQ Trust QQQ, sank 4.2%. It is also in the midst of a correction, declining 11.1% this year and 13.5% from its intraday high, also set on Nov 22.

Meta tops the Nasdaq-100 loser list

Here are the 20 worst performers among the Nasdaq-100 on Feb. 3:
